incidents.name: Account management degraded

incident_updates.body:
Our engineers have implemented a fix and have monitored the results. We can confirm that the issue affecting account management—including retrieving or updating account, subuser, or teammate information via the API or console; creating or managing subusers or teammates; Forgot Password functionality; and new signups—has been resolved.

All services are now operating as expected.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. 

We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around pm 10:15 am Pacific Time on Wednesday, June 11th, our engineers began investigating an issue which may be preventing customers from managing their accounts. 

We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Unified Account Signup & Linking Failures

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issues with creating a new SendGrid account, linking an existing SendGrid account to Twilio, and changing or cancelling paid plans has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Starting around 12:20 pm PDT on 5/20/2025, our engineers began investigating an issue with some SendGrid account management features. Users may have experienced issues creating a new SendGrid account, linking an existing SendGrid account to Twilio, and changing or cancelling paid plans. This did not impact mail send. 

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Intermittent Email Service Disruption

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the systems and confirmed that the issue impacting email sending, templates, and related API requests between 9:35 pm and 9:50 pm PT has been fully resolved. All services are now operating normally.

Our API validation system experienced some unexpected issues between 9:35 pm and 9:50 pm PT. A subset of accounts experienced issues related to sending email, email templates, and associated API requests. This included delays and potential failures when attempting to send mail or access related endpoints. All impacted systems have recovered, and email services are now operating normally.

incidents.name: SSO Login Failure for Reseller Account Users

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed that the issue affecting several Reseller Partner accounts' ability to Single Sign On (SSO) into their SendGrid accounts has been fully resolved. Mail Send functionality was not impacted during this incident. All services are now operating normally.

Our engineers have implemented a fix for the issue affecting several Reseller Partner accounts' ability to Single Sign On (SSO) into their SendGrid accounts. We are currently monitoring system performance to ensure stability. We will provide another update in one hour or sooner if additional information becomes available.
Our engineers have identified the issue and are now working towards a fix. We will provide a new update as soon as it becomes available.

Starting at around 6:30PM Pacific Time on Tuesday, May 13th 2025, our engineers began investigating an issue that is impacting several Reseller Partner accounts with their ability to Single Sign On into their SendGrid accounts. This does not impact Mail Send. We will provide another update in one hour, or sooner as information becomes available.

incidents.name: UI Incorrectly Displaying "Disabled for EU Users" Labels

incident_updates.body: Earlier today, around 2:00 PM PST, some users experienced UI issues where the side navigation menus incorrectly displayed "Disabled for EU Users" labels across available functionality. After investigation, our team identified the cause of the erroneous labels and deployed a fix and confirmed resolved at approximately 2:10 PM PST. All UI functionalities have been restored and verified operational.

Our engineers have applied a fix to the issue and now are monitoring the results, we'll provide an update as soon as it is available
Our engineers have identified the issue and are now working towards a fix. We will provide a new update as soon as it becomes available.

Starting around 11:52pm PT, May 2nd, our engineers started investigating an issue where users are unable to access full functionalities of their account plan changes (upgrades/downgrades), as well as for some new users that are unable to log in at the moment.

Our engineers are investigating the issue and will provide another update within the next hour. Mail send is not affected.

incidents.name: Elevated number of blocked bounces for Apple private relay

incident_updates.body:
Starting around May 2nd, 08,30, PST time, an issue with elevated numbers of blocked bounces for Apple Private Relay began occurring. As a workaround on May 6th, 08:06 PST time, our engineers set these blocks as deferrals so emails can enter the retry queue and be re-sent again. Mail send was affected during this time.

No further action is needed and issue is now solved.

incidents.name: Issues with Sending Emails

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with sending emails has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers are still continuing to monitor system performance. We will provide a new update in two hours, or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers are continuing to monitor system performance to ensure stability and optimal operation. We will provide a new update in two hours, or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have mitigated the issues affecting email sending and have also re-enabled our Bounce Suppressions list. Email traffic is now working 100% with all checks. We will provide another update in 30 minutes, or sooner if additional information becomes available on a full recovery.

We have identified the issue affecting email sending and are actively working on a resolution. As a temporary measure, we have bypassed the Bounce Suppressions list, this would mean emails are being sent to addresses that would normally be suppressed. This step was taken to help ensure that emails continue to be sent. Please note that while emails are currently being delivered, the bounce suppression list is not being checked. We will provide another update in 1 hour, or sooner as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issues affecting email sending. To maximize deliverability, we have temporarily bypassed checking our Bounce Suppressions list. Please note that email addresses currently on the Bounce Suppressions list will not be checked and mail to those addresses will be sent. This measure is intended to help ensure as much expected mail as possible can be delivered. We will provide another update in 30 minutes, or sooner if additional information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issues affecting email sending. To maximize deliverability, we have temporarily bypassed our Bounce Suppressions list. Please note that email addresses currently on the Bounce Suppressions list will not be skipped and mail to those addresses will not be sent. This measure is intended to help ensure as much expected mail as possible can be delivered. We will provide another update in 30 minutes, or sooner if additional information becomes available.

We are continuing to investigate an issue affecting email sending. At this time, emails are being accepted and queued for delivery, but may be delayed. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information is available. We appreciate your patience as we work to resolve this incident.

Starting around 1:55pm PST today, our engineers began investigating an issue with emails being sent. Users may experience issues sending emails at this time. We will provide another update in 30 min or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Marketing Campaigns Contact Delays

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have confirmed that the third party degradation is now marked as resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineering team confirmed that at approximately 1:10 PM PDT, any queued internal processes related to delayed uploads, updates or deletes to Marketing Campaigns contacts for affected accounts have returned to normal levels. Our team will continue to monitor for any further delays due to the third party degradation. Another update will be provided in thirty minutes to confirm that this issue is resolved or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 12 PM PDT on Wednesday, April 16, 2025, our engineers began investigating an issue with uploading, updating, and deleting contacts in Marketing Campaigns. These contact delays have been determined to be a result of a third party service degradation. This issue only affects a subset of accounts using the Marketing Campaigns contacts feature. This issue does not affect mail send directly. We will provide updates in the next hour or sooner as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Can't switch back to parent account

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have thoroughly monitored the fix and have confirmed that the "Return to the Parent Account" issue has been resolved. All services are now fully operational and functioning normally.
Our engineers have successfully implemented a fix and are actively monitoring system performance. We will provide another update as soon as more information becomes available.

Clicking on “return to the parent account” will not return you to the parent account and keeps you logged in as the subuser.

incidents.name: [Retroactive] Event Webhook Posting Delays

incident_updates.body: Our engineering team identified, investigated and corrected an unexpected issue today with the Twilio SendGrid Event Webhook. This optional feature, under normal conditions, allows receiving event data in real time based on email sent via a Twilio SendGrid account. However, between the times of 2:20 PM and 3:30 PM PT, a subset of accounts that had this feature enabled experienced delays to normal event posting due to the issue. Not all accounts with webhook enabled were affected by this delay, and no event data was lost. This issue did not affect mail send. All event postings that were impacted with delays during this period are now processing properly, and all systems are now operating normally.

incidents.name: Emails delayed

incident_updates.body: Between 3:41 PM PT until 3:56 PM PT, on March 27th, our Engineers identified an issue that affected mail send. A subset of customers may have experienced latency in mail send getting processed. A fix has been implemented, and this issue has been resolved. All delayed mail send has been processed.

Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix associated to this login issue. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting at 9:36 am PST today, our engineering team began investigating a problem with login functionality on sendgrid.com. Users might encounter difficulties with page loading or unresponsiveness when attempting to click the login button. Please rest assured, this issue is isolated to the login process and does not affect mail sending capabilities. We are actively working to resolve this and will provide another update in 1 hour, or sooner if new information becomes available.

components.description: Availability of SendGrid.com

incidents.name: Retroactive Incident - Twilio SendGrid Email Processing Delays

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved issues with email processing delays between 6:25AM to 6:32AM PT on February 13, 2025.  A small subset of customers that send mail using the API, SMTP, or Marketing may have experienced email processing delays. The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Retroactive Incident - Missing Data for Legacy and Standard Email Activity

incident_updates.body: Between January 30th, 2025 and February 5th, 2025, a problem occurred with some storage and availability of SendGrid email activity data. Our engineering team identified that this incident only impacted a subset of customers specifically sending via the EU with regionalized sub users. Ongoing impact due to the root cause has been mitigated since February 5th. While impacted email activity data during the affected period for EU sub users is still being investigated for the possibility of restoration, please reach out to our support team if you require assistance and believe to have been affected by this issue.

components.name: Email Activity

incidents.name: Brazil customers not able to open support tickets for logging issues

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated the issue and determined that it is specific to certain browsers. We recommend that customers use a different browser to access the Support Help Center if they are experiencing this issue.

Starting around 2:10pm PST on Feb 12th, our engineers began investigating an issue with the SendGrid Help Center where unauthenticated customers located in Brazil are not being able to escalate login issues. When clicking the "Trouble Logging In" or "Forgot my Username" link,  they are redirected to a "Not logged in" page. This does not impact mail send or authenticated customers who know their username and password. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Inbound Parse Senderauth Domain Error

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with Inbound Parse creation has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. Inbound Parse creation should no longer result in an error when attempting to use an authenticated domain. We will provide another update in 30 minutes.

Starting at 2:00PM PST on January 24th, 2025, our engineers began investigating an error encountered while configuring Inbound Parse: "In order to create a parse setting you must have a matching senderauth domain" This is preventing users from setting up their Inbound Parse, despite having authenticated domains on their accounts. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update within an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: reCAPTCHA in Sign up forms for Marketing showing "Invalid domain for site key" error

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with the sign-up forms has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. The new forms and some forms created before the incident should be already functional, we estimate that in about 2 hours all forms will be functional again. We will provide another update as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. We are still working toward a fix for existing signup forms. New signup forms are now working. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 11:58 AM PT on January 13th, our engineers began investigating an issue with reCAPTCHA displaying an "Invalid domain for site key" error on New Marketing Campaigns Signup Forms. Due to this issue, end users of the forms are currently unable to submit form entries. This does not impact mail send. We've identified the cause, and we're actively working on a fix. We will provide another update as soon as more information becomes available.

Users may experience the error "Your campaign could not be created, please try again in a few moments" when creating a Legacy Marketing campaign. incidents.name: Links in emails resulting in 'Site can't be reached' error.

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have concluded the monitoring status and now all services are back to normal. Links can now be accessed. This incident is officially resolved.
Our engineers have applied a fix and are currently monitoring the results of all services. We'll be monitoring the fix and provide more updates as soon as they become available.
We are continuing to investigate this issue, our engineers are actively looking to understand the root cause and we will be providing updates as soon as they become available.

Starting around 3 AM on 22nd November, 2024 our engineers began investigating an issue with clicking SSL click tracked links in emails wherein the recipients are receiving 500 Origin Error. The origin server is not reachable or returns an error.

The issue has only been observed so far for customers using KeyCDN for their SSL click tracking configuration.

Our team is actively working to identify the root cause and will provide updates within the next hour or as new information becomes available.

incidents.name: Click Tracking degradation

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with click tracking has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

As of approximately 1:30 AM PST on Thursday, November 21, 2024, our engineers began investigating an issue impacting Click Tracking URLs using 'ct.sendgrid.net'.

This issue affects customers who have enabled click tracking but have not configured link branding.

This does not affect mail send.

Our team is actively working to identify the root cause and will provide updates within the next hour or as new information becomes available.

incidents.name: Intermmittent login issues after adding credentials

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. All systems are operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have applied a fix and are monitoring the results, we will provide an update in an hour or as soon as more updates become available

Starting 6:43 AM PT (exact time will be determined soon), our engineers began investigating issues when accessing the account using credentials as username and password. When adding the right credentials, users receive an error of 'Your username or password is invalid'. 

This is only affecting password users, meaning that SSO users are not affected.

This does not affect mail send.

Customers seem to have success accessing the account by retrying again or using an incognito window. Our engineers are currently investigating the current behavior and will provide an update within an hour or as soon as they become available.

incidents.name: SendGrid Event Delays for EU Regions

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Starting around 1:00 PM PST on Saturday, November 16th, 2024, our Engineers began investigating an issue with SendGrid Events. Customers may experience delays with Event reporting associated to mail send. The issue is causing intermittent errors and delays on Events (webhook, open and click events, Stats and Email Activity Feed events). This does not impact mail send. We are actively working to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.
